id: #BCVotes: British Columbians head to the polls — and pose for the camera
paragraph: It's finally here! It's municipal election day across the province and eligible voters are casting ballots — and sharing the voting selfie.Many municipalities across the province are encouraging voters to take selfies to celebrate their civic pride — but make sure it's outside the polling station because some municipalities say taking a photo inside is a violation of privacy.And be wary of photographing your ballot. In the City of Vancouver, for example, section 125(3) (b) of the Vancouver Charter states that no one may reproduce a ballot (this means via photograph as well).We did the thing! #VancouverVotes #vanelxn18 pic.twitter.com/254ndTDXvQKeep the great photos coming #SurreyBC. Wear, share & use #surreyvotes! pic.twitter.com/UTc9xZm5nLI did it! In and out with plenty of time to enjoy my lunch break. You’re stuck with these people for four years making decisions that affect you (their impacts lasting even longer)...you can take 15 mins to vote 🗳 #yyj #yyjpoli #VictoriaVotes pic.twitter.com/RbknXjP4VkWe voted. #CQvotes2018 pic.twitter.com/GitvRutwQv@chickenpeepo Rock the vote! #PGVotes #rockthevote #youthvote pic.twitter.com/WLmsJeC0OQDid you? #vancouvervotes pic.twitter.com/k68fJ6hSwZGot my vote on at lunch today👍. If you don’t vote, you can’t complain😜 #beinvolved #haveyoursay #civicelection #kelownavotes #engagedcitizen pic.twitter.com/EtjNXkykL4It’s a privilege to vote with the two people who are the reason for my existence. They’re the reason I have the privilege of taking part in democracy and freedom of speech as a Canadian #MunicipalElections2018 ✔️📨✏️ pic.twitter.com/WnVec73p3bYay we did it #SurreyVotes pic.twitter.com/QgGmRppj4pVote for change in #Nanaimo. #vote #VotingMatters #democracy #nanelxn18 #Nanaimovotes pic.twitter.com/QFoJDz4waOMy 84 year old grandma got ready and just went to vote. What's your excuse not to? #SurreyVotes #Surrey #Vote #BcPoli pic.twitter.com/6ycJ2q1aeRWho says young people aren’t interested in politics? #bcpoli #newwestvotes pic.twitter.com/FiWcv30VUrAudience Relations, CBC P.O.
